required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Effect of Energy Drink Consumption on Alcohol-Substance Use and It's Relationship With Impulsivity In University Students
clinical_study.official_title: The Effect of Energy Drink Consumption on Alcohol-Substance Use and It's Relationship With Impulsivity In University Students

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of this study is to investigate the prevalence of energy drink, alcohol and substance use among university students; to explore whether there is a relationship between energy drink consumption and alcohol-substance use in university students or not and to evaluate effect of impulsiveness and sensation seeking on this relationship.

primary_outcome.measure: Measurement of the prevalence of energy drink consumption among university students by using energy drink consumption questionnaire
Measurement of the prevalence of alcohol consumption among university students by using addiction profile index
Measurement of the prevalence of substance use among university students by using addiction profile index
Assessment of sensation seeking among university students by using Zuckerman Sensation Seeking Scale
Assessment of impulsivity among university students by using Barratt Impulsiveness Scale

arm_group.description: In Addiction Profile Index, university students who use alcohol in last year.

arm_group.arm_group_label: University students who don't use alcohol
arm_group.description: In Addiction Profile Index, university students who don't use alcohol in last year.

arm_group.arm_group_label: University students who use energy drinks
arm_group.description: In energy drink consumption questionnaire, university students who use energy drinks in last year.

arm_group.arm_group_label: University students who don't use energy drinks
arm_group.description: In energy drink consumption questionnaire, university students who don't use energy drinks in last year.
In Addiction Profile Index, university students who use substance in last year.

arm_group.arm_group_label: University students who don't use substance
arm_group.description: In Addiction Profile Index, university students who don't use substance in last year.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- To be university student
- To be ≥ 18 years old
Exclusion Criteria:
- Not willing to participate the study

results_reference.citation: Arria AM, Caldeira KM, Kasperski SJ, Vincent KB, Griffiths RR, O'Grady KE. Energy drink consumption and increased risk for alcohol dependence. Alcohol Clin Exp Res. 2011 Feb;35(2):365-75. doi: 10.1111/j.1530-0277.2010.01352.x. Epub 2010 Nov 12.

Brache K, Stockwell T. Drinking patterns and risk behaviors associated with combined alcohol and energy drink consumption in college drinkers. Addict Behav. 2011 Dec;36(12):1133-40. doi: 10.1016/j.addbeh.2011.07.003. Epub 2011 Jul 23.

Marczinski CA. Alcohol mixed with energy drinks: consumption patterns and motivations for use in U.S. college students. Int J Environ Res Public Health. 2011 Aug;8(8):3232-45. doi: 10.3390/ijerph8083232. Epub 2011 Aug 5.

Velazquez CE, Poulos NS, Latimer LA, Pasch KE. Associations between energy drink consumption and alcohol use behaviors among college students. Drug Alcohol Depend. 2012 Jun 1;123(1-3):167-72. doi: 10.1016/j.drugalcdep.2011.11.006. Epub 2011 Dec 3.
